Description: Bronze lamp with a rounded body, a wide rounded shoulder, and a short low-placed nozzle, slightly splayed, with a rounded tip and a circular wick-hole. The top is slightly dished, with concentric grooves round the small filling-hole. At the rear are traces of a lost handle. The raised circular base is applied, and perhaps belongs; within are `lathe-turned' mouldings.
Bibliographic references: Lamp / Catalogue of the Lamps in the British Museum (Q3710)
